title: 103_hr2173
content: The Act may be cited as the "Harbor Environmental Dredging and Management Act of 1993" and includes a dumping permit program for dredged material. The "Harbor Environmental Dredging and Management Act of 1993" includes a dumping permit program for dredged material. Section 103 of the Marine Protection, Research, and Sanctuaries Act of 1973 is amended to include a procedure for the Secretary to review permit applications within 15 days and publish a notice for public comment. The "Harbor Environmental Dredging and Management Act of 1993" amends the Marine Protection, Research, and Sanctuaries Act of 1973 to include a process for the Secretary to review permit applications within 15 days and solicit public comments. Interested agencies and persons can provide input on the application, and the Secretary may conduct a public hearing if necessary, with a deadline of 30 days after the comment period ends. The Secretary must provide necessary information to the EPA and other federal agencies within 15 days of receiving all application information. The Secretary and the Administrator will evaluate the application concurrently and may confer to complete the process efficiently. The Secretary must make a determination on issuing a permit within 90 days after the comment period or public hearing. Criteria and standards will be applied to assess if proposed dumping will cause unreasonable degradation or endangerment. The Secretary must make a determination on issuing a permit within 90 days after the comment period or public hearing. Criteria and standards will be applied to assess if proposed dumping will cause unreasonable degradation or endangerment. Additionally, the Secretary must consider the impact of not dredging on human health, welfare, and various values. The determination for issuing a permit must be made within 165 days of receiving the application. The Secretary must respond to the Administrator's information request within 15 days of receiving it. The time frame for concurrence by the Administrator has been reduced from 45 to 30 days. Additionally, a conforming amendment includes subsections (d) and (e) in the section. SEC. 3. Dioxin contaminated sediment disposal standard to be developed within 6 months of enactment. National standard for disposal of dioxin-contaminated sediments to be established in consultation with the Secretary of the Army. Applies to determinations under section 103 of the Marine Protection, Research, and Sanctuaries Act of 1973. SEC. 4. Mud dump containment island. The Administrator of the EPA and the Secretary of the Army will develop a plan for a containment island as an alternative to the Mud Dump Site for contaminated dredged material disposal. The plan will include the island's location, construction timetable, cost estimate, financing mechanisms, and decontamination technologies. A report is due within 12 months. The Administrator and the Secretary will submit a plan to Congress within 12 months, along with recommendations for implementation. SEC. 5. CONTAINMENT AND CLEAN-UP OF DIOXIN IN PASSAIC RIVER, NEW JERSEY. The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency and the Secretary of the Army, in consultation with State authorities, will develop a comprehensive plan for containing, cleaning up, and preventing dioxin contamination in the Passaic River basin near Newark, New Jersey. The plan must include strategies for monitoring, containing, and preventing dioxin spread, cleanup with a proposed timetable and cost estimate, and preventing land activities from causing new dioxin pollution in the area. The Administrator and the Secretary will develop a comprehensive plan to prevent dioxin pollution in the Passaic River basin and Newark Bay, including monitoring sediment sources in Newark Bay. A report with recommendations for implementation will be submitted to Congress within 6 months of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of the Army can approve a consortium of permittees for testing and disposing of dredged materials to enhance cost-effective disposal and environmental management.
